user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.14 is: The Standard Library function memcmp shall not be used to compare null terminated strings.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_BinSemGetInfo_Impl:
```c
int32 OS_BinSemGetInfo_Impl(const OS_object_token_t *token, OS_bin_sem_prop_t *sem_prop)
{
    OS_impl_binsem_internal_record_t *sem;

    sem = OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(OS_impl_bin_sem_table, *token);

    /* put the info into the structure */
    sem_prop->value = sem->current_value;
    return OS_SUCCESS;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function OS_BinSemGetInfo_Impl:
#define OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(tbl, tok) (&tbl[OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(&(tok))])
...
static inline osal_index_t OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(const OS_object_token_t *token)
{
    return token->obj_idx;
}
...
typedef struct OS_object_token OS_object_token_t
...
OS_impl_binsem_internal_record_t OS_impl_bin_sem_table[OS_MAX_BIN_SEMAPHORES]
...
typedef struct
{
    pthread_mutex_t       id;
    pthread_cond_t        cv;
    volatile sig_atomic_t flush_request;
    volatile sig_atomic_t current_value;
} OS_impl_binsem_internal_record_t
...
typedef struct
{
    char      name[OS_MAX_API_NAME];
    osal_id_t creator;
    int32     value;
} OS_bin_sem_prop_t
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No use of memcmp is present in the provided target function or the related symbols. The function OS_BinSemGetInfo_Impl performs only an index lookup and copies a numeric value (sem->current_value) into sem_prop->value — no string operations or comparisons occur. The helper macro and inline function (OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET, OS_ObjectIndexFromToken) do not perform any string comparisons either. The only character array shown (OS_bin_sem_prop_t.name) is not accessed in the displayed code, so there is no instance of memcmp being used to compare null-terminated strings in the supplied fragments. Therefore, there are no code fragments here that need investigation for MISRA C:2023 Rule 21.14.
